caption.p: Potential interactions between COVID-19 regimen and commonly used HF and transplant medications

tr.th: Potential HF and transplant patient medication

tr.td: Hydroxychloroquine inhibits CYP2D6 increasing beta blocker concentration ➔ monitor for bradycardia and AV block
Higher risk of QTc prolongation and TdP
Hydroxychloroquine may increase serum concentration of cyclosporine through unknown mechanisms
Hydroxychloroquine may inhibit p-glycoprotein-mediated digoxin transport ➔ may increase digoxin concentration
Lpv/R inhibits CYP3A4 ➔ increase in antiarrhythmic concentration, side effects, and QTc prolongation
Lpv/R inhibits CYP3A4 ➔ increase in concentration of eplerenone
Lpv/R inhibits CYP3A4 ➔ increase in concentration of ivabradine
Lpv/R inhibits CYP3A4 ➔ increase in concentration of tacrolimus
Lpv/R inhibits CYP3A4 ➔ increase in concentration of tacrolimus
Lpv/R may decrease VKA concentration through induction of metabolism (CYP2C9) and other uncertain mechanisms
